metadata.title: CVE-2014-1874 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
The security_context_to_sid_core function in security/selinux/ss/services.cin the Linux kernel before 3.13.4 allows local users to cause a denial ofservice (system crash) by leveraging the CAP_MAC_ADMIN capability to set azero-length security context.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-1874` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-8-generic - 3.13.0-8.28
linux-image-3.13.0-8-generic-lpae - 3.13.0-8.28
linux-image-3.13.0-8-lowlatency - 3.13.0-8.28
linux-image-3.13.0-8-powerpc-e500 - 3.13.0-8.28
linux-image-3.13.0-8-powerpc-e500mc - 3.13.0-8.28
linux-image-3.13.0-8-powerpc-smp - 3.13.0-8.28
linux-image-3.13.0-8-powerpc64-emb - 3.13.0-8.28
linux-image-3.13.0-8-powerpc64-smp - 3.13.0-8.28
linux-image-extra-3.13.0-8-generic - 3.13.0-8.28
No subscription required

linux-image-3.16.0-25-generic - 3.16.0-25.33~14.04.2
